poem:
### The Ribbon Unfurled

At Paris, the ribbons of nations twirl,
yet shadows play on the mat,
wars looping in the background.

Athletes leap in silent defiance,
while whispers of conflict weave
an invisible scoreboard.

No medals for peace,
no anthem for a truce,
just the momentary grace
of bodies in flight.
